alert.note: Alert for Le Sueur; Rice; Steele; Waseca (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 26 at 6:24AM CDT by NWS Minneapolis
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Le Sueur, Steele, eastern Waseca and southwestern Rice Counties through 700 AM CDT... At 624 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Morristown, or 12 miles southwest of Faribault, moving south at 50 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Waseca around 630 AM CDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include New Richland and Ellendale. This includes the following highways... Interstate 35 between mile markers 27 and 48. U.S. Highway 14 between mile markers 153 and 178. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
